Deprecated API

Contents

  • Deprecated Interfaces
  • Deprecated Classes
  • Deprecated Exceptions
  • Deprecated Methods
  • Deprecated Interfaces 
    Interface and Description
    jcsp.lang.BufferedChannelArrayFactory
    These channel factories are deprecated in favour of the new one2one() methods in the Channel class.
    jcsp.lang.BufferedChannelFactory
    These channel factories are deprecated in favour of the new one2one() methods in the Channel class.
    jcsp.lang.BufferedChannelIntArrayFactory
    These channel factories are deprecated in favour of the new one2one() methods in the Channel class.
    jcsp.lang.BufferedChannelIntFactory
    These channel factories are deprecated in favour of the new one2one() methods in the Channel class.
    jcsp.lang.ChannelArrayFactory
    These channel factories are deprecated in favour of the new one2one() methods in the Channel class.
    jcsp.lang.ChannelFactory
    These channel factories are deprecated in favour of the new one2one() methods in the Channel class.
    jcsp.lang.ChannelIntArrayFactory
    These channel factories are deprecated in favour of the new one2one() methods in the Channel class.
    jcsp.lang.ChannelIntFactory
    These channel factories are deprecated in favour of the new one2one() methods in the Channel class.
    jcsp.lang.RejectableChannel
    This channel is superceded by the poison mechanisms, please see PoisonException. It remains only because it is used by some of the networking features.
    jcsp.lang.RejectableChannelInput
    This channel is superceded by the poison mechanisms, please see PoisonException. It remains only because it is used by some of the networking features.
    jcsp.lang.RejectableChannelOutput
    This channel is superceded by the poison mechanisms, please see PoisonException. It remains only because it is used by some of the networking features.
  • Deprecated Classes 
    Class and Description
    jcsp.demos.util.Ask
    use package UesrIO instead
    jcsp.lang.ChannelInputWrapper
    There is no longer any need to use this class, after the 1.1 class reorganisation.
    jcsp.lang.ChannelInt
    To create integer channels, use the methods in the Channel class.
    jcsp.lang.ChannelOutputWrapper
    There is no longer any need to use this class, after the 1.1 class reorganisation.
    jcsp.demos.util.ComplexDouble
    use package UserIo instead
    jcsp.net2.NetChannelEnd
    To conform with the core package naming scheme, the class NetChannel has also been provided
    jcsp.lang.RejectableAltingChannelInput
    This channel is superceded by the poison mechanisms, please see PoisonException
    jcsp.lang.RejectableBufferedOne2AnyChannel
    This channel is superceded by the poison mechanisms, please see PoisonException
    jcsp.lang.RejectableBufferedOne2OneChannel
    This channel is superceded by the poison mechanisms, please see PoisonException
    jcsp.lang.RejectableOne2AnyChannel
    This channel is superceded by the poison mechanisms, please see PoisonException. It remains only because it is used by some of the networking features.
    jcsp.lang.RejectableOne2OneChannel
    This channel is superceded by the poison mechanisms, please see PoisonException. It remains only because it is used by some of the networking features.
    jcsp.net2.tcpip.TCPIPCNSServer
    Use TCPIPNodeFactory instead
    jcsp.net2.tcpip.TCPIPNodeFactory
    This method of Node initialisation should no longer be used. See Node for more information
  • Deprecated Exceptions 
    Exceptions and Description
    jcsp.util.filter.PoisonFilterException
    Use poison directly instead
  • Deprecated Methods 
    Method and Description
    jcsp.lang.Channel.createAny2Any()
    Use the Channel.any2any() method instead.
    jcsp.lang.Channel.createAny2Any(ChannelDataStore)
    Use the Channel.any2any(ChannelDataStore) method instead.
    jcsp.lang.Channel.createAny2Any(ChannelDataStore, int)
    Use the Channel.any2anyArray(int,ChannelDataStore) method instead.
    jcsp.lang.Channel.createAny2Any(int)
    Use the Channel.any2anyArray(int) method instead.
    jcsp.net2.NetChannel.createAny2Net(NetChannelLocation)
    Use any2net instead
    jcsp.net2.NetChannelEnd.createAny2Net(NetChannelLocation)
    Use any2net instead
    jcsp.net2.StandardNetChannelEndFactory.createAny2Net(NetChannelLocation)
    Use any2net instead
    jcsp.net2.cns.CNS.createAny2Net(String)
    Use one2net instead
    jcsp.lang.Channel.createAny2One()
    Use the Channel.any2one() method instead.
    jcsp.lang.Channel.createAny2One(ChannelDataStore)
    Use the Channel.any2one(ChannelDataStore) method instead.
    jcsp.lang.Channel.createAny2One(ChannelDataStore, int)
    Use the Channel.any2oneArray(int,ChannelDataStore) method instead.
    jcsp.lang.Channel.createAny2One(int)
    Use the Channel.any2oneArray(int) method instead.
    jcsp.net2.NetChannel.createNet2Any()
    Use net2any instead
    jcsp.net2.NetChannelEnd.createNet2Any()
    Use net2any instead
    jcsp.net2.StandardNetChannelEndFactory.createNet2Any()
    Use net2any instead
    jcsp.net2.cns.CNS.createNet2Any(String)
    Use net2any instead
    jcsp.net2.NetChannel.createNet2One()
    Use net2one instead
    jcsp.net2.NetChannelEnd.createNet2One()
    Use net2one instead
    jcsp.net2.StandardNetChannelEndFactory.createNet2One()
    Use net2one instead
    jcsp.net2.cns.CNS.createNet2One(String)
    Use net2one instead
    jcsp.lang.Channel.createOne2Any()
    Use the Channel.one2any() method instead.
    jcsp.lang.Channel.createOne2Any(ChannelDataStore)
    Use the Channel.one2any(ChannelDataStore) method instead.
    jcsp.lang.Channel.createOne2Any(ChannelDataStore, int)
    Use the Channel.one2anyArray(int,ChannelDataStore) method instead.
    jcsp.lang.Channel.createOne2Any(int)
    Use the Channel.one2anyArray(int) method instead.
    jcsp.net2.NetChannel.createOne2Net(NetChannelLocation)
    Use one2net instead
    jcsp.net2.NetChannelEnd.createOne2Net(NetChannelLocation)
    Use one2net instead
    jcsp.net2.StandardNetChannelEndFactory.createOne2Net(NetChannelLocation)
    Use one2net instead
    jcsp.net2.cns.CNS.createOne2Net(String)
    Use one2net instead
    jcsp.lang.Channel.createOne2One()
    Use the Channel.one2one() method instead.
    jcsp.lang.Channel.createOne2One(ChannelDataStore)
    Use the Channel.one2one(ChannelDataStore) method instead.
    jcsp.lang.Channel.createOne2One(ChannelDataStore, int)
    Use the Channel.one2oneArray(int,ChannelDataStore) method instead.
    jcsp.lang.Channel.createOne2One(int)
    Use the Channel.one2oneArray(int) method instead.
    jcsp.net.NodeAddressID.getStringForm()
    This is going to be removed from the API. The purpose of this mechanism was so that channel information could be encoded into anonymous channels' channel names.
    jcsp.lang.CSTimer.set(long)
    Use CSTimer.setAlarm(long) - this name caused confusion with the idea of setting the current time (a concept that is not supported).
    jcsp.lang.ProcessManager.stop()
